title: Man in his early 20s is stabbed 'multiple times' in Westfield shopping centre in Lawless London
text:
A man believed to be in his early 20s has suffered multiple stab wounds at Westfield Shopping Centre in Shepherd's Bush.

Police were called to the scene shortly after 7pm this evening.

The victim was treated by paramedics before being taken to a west London hospital.

His condition is not yet known.

A man believed to be in his early 20s has suffered multiple stab wounds at Westfield Shopping Centre in Shepherd's Bush

Police were called to the centre at 7pm this evening. The victim was treated by paramedics before being taken to a west London hospital

It comes just hours after a man was left fighting for his life after being stabbed in the capital.

Officers were called to Turner Street in Whitechapel at 2.05pm to reports of men fighting.

One man was found with stab wounds and was taken to hospital in a critical condition, the Met police said.

Two men were arrested at the scene on suspicion of attempted murder and have been taken into custody.

A man is fighting for his life after being stabbed in east London and two men were arrested at the scene (pictured)

One man was found with stab wounds and was taken to hospital in a critical condition, the Met police said

Tower Hamlets Police said a male is in a critical condition after being stabbed in Turner Street, Whitechapel

Scotland Yard said a crime scene was put in place on Turner Street.

Two teenagers were stabbed to death within hours of each other in the capital on Thursday.

Baptista Adjei, 15, from North Woolwich, was attacked on or after getting off a bus which stopped near to the Stratford Shopping Centre.

Police were called to the incident on Broadway in Stratford, east London, shortly after 3pm.

Victim: Baptista Adjei, 15, pictured by his former football team, was stabbed to death in Stratford, east London yesterday

A bunch of flowers with 'RIP BAPS' on it is pictured at the police cordon in Stratford today

Baptista was found with 'critical injuries' and was pronounced dead at the scene at 3.49pm.

Police said a 15-year-old boy who handed himself in to an east London police station was arrested on suspicion of murder.

Five hours later, at 8.21pm, officers were called to the Brandon Estate in Camberwell, south London, where they found an 18-year-old man with stab wounds.

He died an hour later, the Met said.
description: Police were called to the shopping centre in Shepherd's Bush just after 7pm. The victim was treated by paramedics before being taken to a west London hospital. His condition is not yet known.
